phrases: Hey, what did you just say?
It is the first time I have looked down at someone
since I started high school club activities.
Do not weep with joy about it!
You are not looking that far down!
The tall guy with the nasty glare.
What junior high are you from?
No wonder you serve like that.
We played against you guys and lost 2 to 1.
Your serve was amazing then, too.
What junior high were you at, Nishinoya-san?
Why did you come to Karasuno?
Because you heard coach Ukai was coming back?
No... I came to Karasuno because...
Because I like the girl's uniform.
And the girls have lived up to my expectations.
I wore a blazer in junior high, so I admired this uniform.
It is not brown or grey, but black!
Karasuno has black uniforms, and the girl's uniform is cute.
I have come to see you!
He is like a hurricane, as usual.
Quite the noisemaker, is not he?
Yet when he plays, he is surprisingly...
Do not talk like that about your senpai!
If Asahi-san's not coming back, neither am I.
My job is to keep things connected.
The sky is the domain of the spikers.
It is not a place where I can battle,
but if I keep things connected... as long I maintain connections...
the ace will surely score for our side.
Even if the ball bounces off the wall...
I will make sure it stays connected.
Give me another chance to let you decide the toss...
Episode 8: He who is Called Ace
Nishiya-san, you are a libero, right?
And what makes you think I am a libero?
Because you are a good receiver.
Libero is a position vfor good receivers, right?
That is right, is not it?
You know what you are talking about.
Plus, the captain also called you the Guardian God.
But I do not care if he called me a cool name like that.
I will not bend so easily.
I am still lousy at receiving,
even though it is the most important thing in volleyball.
So please teach me how, Nishi...
I will buy you ice cream after practice.
That does not mean I am going back to that club.
I am going to teach you.
You go zip, then go whoop, and pow.
He cannot explain it because he moves purely on instinct.
I sort of understood what he was saying.
Because you belong to his species.
all you say is pow and woah and stuff.
Libero is a special position, is not it?
The libero specializes exclusively in defense.
They are not allowed to make offensive plays, like serving or spiking.
They switch places with the rearguards to solidify defense.
So that is the Guardian God of Karasuno.
It would give us a real shot in the arm if he came back.
He has a very strong presence, notwithstanding his short stature.
You, I have been noticing your height.
In any case, Nishinoya has not lost his touch at all.
He said he continued training even after he got suspended.
He mingled with the girl's team, he said.
Moron, do not say that name carelessly.
He is Karasuno's ace, for what it is worth.
So there is an ace here.
What is with the empty-headed look?
You want it because it is awesome, right?
You would be far more impressive than our current ace.
But then again, it is the ace that inspires you.
The word ace has an awesome ring to it.
But... in a match, when the crowd is going crazy...
even more than at an amazing spike,
is when there is a super receive.
In the battle of height that is volleyball,
libero is one of the few positions in which a short player can survive.
But I am not a libero because of my height.
I would be a libero even if I was two meters tall.
Even if your side misses the spike, even if your side cannot block...
as long as the ball does not hit the court...
in volleyball, that means you have not lost.
And the one best suited to do that...
Do not say it so sincerely!
I will buy you two kinds of ice cream.
You are a lousy receiver, but there must be something you are good at.
Why do you say it with such a lack of confidence?
Because it does not sound flashy like ace or Guardian God.
If a spiker is able to score it is because of you, the decoy,
then your position is just as important.
Karasuno has the most formidable decoy now.
Thanks to Hinata and Kageyama, spikes that have never worked are possible.
I feel we are definitely about to change,
because of the synergy Takeda-sensei was talking about.
I hope we change for the better.
I know I am being stubborn, but I am begging you.
I am inexperienced and pathetically inadequate.
But those boys have wonderful potential.
That is the only thing I am good at.
Being tenacious will not get me to coach them.
My granddad was a coach, but I am not cut out for it.
Sensei, I know you want an technical instructor,
but what you are really after is the illustrious name of Ukai.
our school gradually fell behind other schools.
This year I was hired to fill the hole he had left,
but I cannot even get other schools to agree to a practice matches.
You think my illustrious name would turn things around?
but I do not want to babysit a bunch of pesky high schoolers.
What part of, I refuse, do not you understand?
I am sorry for being so persistent,
you will understand if you see those boys play.
I do not care how many times you ask.
It is reassuring to have Nishinoya behind you.
Everyone feels better when you are there to decide the toss.
but I would get in everyone is way again if I came back.
We have an amazing first-year setter now,
You will not have to bear all the burden alone any more.
If you and Nishinoya come back,
Karasuno will no longer be the fallen champs.
Our team is on the verge of transformation.
Now more than ever we need our pillar, the ace...
The guidance counselor's ready for you.
You are the one who wanted to see the ace.
B-But the third-year classroom is scary.
What are you guys doing here?
Let me introduce our new members, Hinata and Kageyama.
but there is something bigger about him.
So he is the ace of Karasuno.
He is not as scary as I first thought.
Are not you going to play, too?
I want to become the ace,
so I want to watch an ace play in person.
Sorry, but I am no ace.
No, it is not like that...
He does not like volleyball any more.
He is so tall and he is an ace!
He rescued us when things got rough and managed difficult balls.
Everyone acknowledged that he was the ace.
There was a match in which all of his spikes got blocked.
He is the type to shoulder all the blame.
Would something like that make you dislike volleyball?
There must have been other reasons.
But we do not know for sure that he dislikes it.
That is just an ordinary rolling receive.
Why did he yell that out?
I am going to lecture you all.
Get lower than my line of vision.
I want you all to listen up.
We are doing it again this year, are not we?
We still need a lot of practice.
For the last day of Golden Week...
I have arranged a practice match!
A venerated school in Tokyo, Nekoma High School.
We have heard a lot about them.
Our former coach and theirs were rivals.
We played each other a lot.
Those famous matches were called Cat vs Raven: Battle at the Garbage Dump.
You sure those matches were famous?
They have refused us for a while.
Yeah, I will tell you the details later.
But after I heard about that rival school,
I had to arrange for a rematch of destiny.
I think when he hears who our opponent is...
He will want to take action.
We have an important practice match coming up.
I will smash those city boys to smithereens.
I will not be playing in the practice match.
I wonder what the Tokyo school's like.
The first-years are interesting and a force to be reckoned with.
I feel this team is going in the right direction now.
I want to train with you all, too.
if I played in the match and our team won,
it would be proof that we can do without Asahi-san.
He is always fought alongside us, but now...
I am sorry I am being difficult.
Understood, but come to training camp.
Show me the Rolling Thunder again!
I wonder if things would go smoother
for Sugawara-san and Nishinoya-san if Asahi-san came back.
I heard Asahi-san takes all the blame upon himself,
but do not you think Sugawara-san is like that, too?
I guess they both have a sense of responsibility,
even though you do not win a game by yourself.
I wish I could receive, toss, and spike, all by myself.
Everyone on our side of the net should be an ally.
I do not like it when we do not get along.
Why are you so interested in me?
We have not even practiced together.
Because if you do not come back,
the second and third-years will stay disheartened.
You are being way too loud.
But, I am sorry to say...
I can no longer visualize spiking past high blocks in front of me.
I cannot get the thoughts of getting shut out,
of seeing myself intimidated, and self-destructing out of my head...
You might think what I am about to say is cocky for a first-year shrimp.
I am short and have no skills, so I constantly get blocked.
I have this guy tossing to me,
so I can get past any blocker.
All the blockers vanish from sight...
And the view of the other side of the net opens up.
Ah... I sort of know what that view is like.
Then, at the highest point, the ball hits my hand,
I feel the heft of the ball snug in my palm.
I do not have the height or power to spike through blockers on my own,
Maybe they have blocked lots of your spikes,
but you have spiked lots of points, too, have not you?
That is why everyone calls you the ace, Asahi-san.
Moron, we will be late for class.
That is just how it is.
That is why there are six players on the court.
I did not realize that til just recently,
so I am not one to talk.
Want to grab a bite somewhere?
And then at the highest point, the ball hits my hand,
I feel the heft of the ball, snug in my palm
I wish Azumane-san would come back.
Maybe I would be like an ace if I grew a stubbly beard.
Will a hair-growth lotion help me grow a beard?
Episode 9: A Toss to the Ace
